content.raw:
Well, if you downloaded the release tarball and ran setup.py it would work, but installing from source requires build dependencies.

However there are command line args for disabling the icon building for the qt versions you're not interested in. So python setup.py NO_PYQT4 NO_PYSIDE NO_PYSIDE2 would work.

Autodetecting what's there and building with only that could work...we could change it to do that I suppose. Or just document the command line args.
content.html:
Well, if you downloaded the release tarball and ran setup.py it would work, but installing from source requires build dependencies.

However there are command line args for disabling the icon building for the qt versions you're not interested in. So python setup.py NO_PYQT4 NO_PYSIDE NO_PYSIDE2 would work.

Autodetecting what's there and building with only that could work...we could change it to do that I suppose. Or just document the command line args.
